TallyScore: (n,nc) Continuum level inelastic scattering reaction rate
delayed-nu-fission: Total production of delayed neutrons due to fission
prompt-nu-fission: Total production of prompt neutrons due to fission
nu-fission: Total production of neutrons due to fission
He4-production: Total production of He4 (alpha particles)
current: Partial currents on the cell boundaries
heating-local: Total nuclear heating assuming energy is deposited locally
fission-q-prompt: Prompt fission energy production rate
fission-q-recoverable: Recoverable fission energy production rate

only_fissionable: Whether spatial sites should only be accepted if they occur in fissionable materials

coefficient: Probability density given by a Legendre polynomial expansion $\sum\limits_{\ell=0}^N \frac{2\ell + 1}{2} a_\ell P_\ell(\mu)$. $\newline$ Expansion coefficients $a_\ell$. Note that the $(2\ell + 1)/2$ factor should not be included

phi: Distribution of phi-coordinates (azimuthal angle) in a reference frame specified by the origin parameter
origin: Coordinates (x0, y0, z0) of the center of the cylindrical reference frame for the source.

name: Name
ComponentName
fraction: The fraction of relevant nuclei that are affected by the $S(\alpha, \beta)$ table.

theta: The Maxwellian distribution in energy is characterized by a single parameter $\theta$ and has a density function $p(E) dE = c \sqrt{E} e^{-E/\theta} dE$

e0: The Muir energy spectrum is a Gaussian spectrum, but for convenience reasons allows the user 3 parameters to define the distribution, the mean energy of particles, the mass of reactants, and the ion temperature
m_rat: Ratio of the sum of the masses of the reaction inputs to an AMU

thresholds: Tally cells with a value outside this range will not be displayed
sourceNormalization: Per-particle tally scores are normalized to this many source particles (a factor of {{ appState.models.openmcAnimation.sourceNormalization / appState.models.settings.particles }})

mu: Distribution of the cosine of the polar angle
phi: Distribution of the azimuthal angle in radians

a: The power law distribution has density function $p(x) dx = c x^n dx$
n: Power law exponent. Defaults to zero, which is equivalent to a uniform distribution

useReflectivePlanes: Add reflective planes for sector models. $Ax + By + Cz = D$

inactive: These batches will be used to converge the eigenvalue before calculations begin
photon_transport: Simulate the passage of photons through matter
run_mode: The type of calculation to perform
max_splits: Maximum number of particle splits for weight windows

file: openmc source file in hdf5 format

theta: Distribution of theta-coordinates (angle relative to the z-axis) in a reference frame specified by the origin parameter
phi: Distribution of phi-coordinates (azimuthal angle) in a reference frame specified by the origin parameter
origin: Coordinates (x0, y0, z0) of the center of the spherical reference frame for the source

weight: Weight cutoff below which particle undergo Russian roulette
weight_avg: Weight assigned to particles that are not killed after Russian roulette

name: Name
String
nuclides: List of nuclides to use when scoring results

a: The Watt fission energy spectrum is characterized by two parameters $a$ and $b$ and has density function $p(E) dE = c e^{-E/a} \sinh \sqrt{b \, E} dE$
